articles.author: Javier Eguiluz
articles.description:
Codex is a cloud-based coding agent created by OpenAI. It can run multiple tasks in parallel to fix bugs, implement features, suggest improvements, and more. It can even create pull requests on platforms like GitHub.
Although Codex already works well with PHP, providing solid code suggestions and improvements, its most powerful feature is that it can run your code (e.g., executing your test suite) to verify that its proposed changes actually work. This is a game-changer for languages like Python or JavaScript, where code execution is supported out of the box.
PHP, however, is not natively supported for code execution. This article explains how to make Codex work effectively with PHP and Symfony applications, including how to configure it to run your test suite and validate changes automati‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Make ChatGPT Codex Work with PHP and Symfony

articles.author: Marcos Oliveira
articles.description:
Build your games with more scalability, organization, performance, and flexibility.





The Entity Component System (ECS) pattern is widely used in game development and modular logic applications. It separates data (components), behavior (systems), and entities (IDs).
Entity: just an ID (e.g., Player = 1)
Component: pure data (e.g., Position, Velocity, Health)
System: logic that operates on entities with certain components (e.g., physics system uses Position and Velocity)
Performance: cache-friendly, contiguous memory access
Flexibility: add/remove behaviors without inheritance or conditionals
Scalability: easy to manage hundreds/thousands of entities
Organization: clear separation of data and logic
struct Position { float x, y; };
struct Velocity { float dx, dy; };

for (auto entity : en‚Ä¶
articles.title: The 12 Best Entity Component Systems for C++

articles.author: Marcos Oliveira
articles.description:

Entity (Entidade): apenas um ID (ex: Player = 1)
Component (Componente): dados puros (ex: Position, Velocity, Health)
System (Sistema): l√≥gica que atua sobre entidades com certos componentes (ex: sistema de f√≠sica usa Position e Velocity)
Performance: acesso a dados cont√≠guos na mem√≥ria (cache-friendly)
Flexibilidade: adiciona/remove comportamentos sem heran√ßa ou ifs
Escalabilidade: f√°cil lidar com centenas/milhares de entidades
Organiza√ß√£o: separa claramente dados e l√≥gica
struct Position { float ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Os 12 Melhores Entity Component System para C++

articles.author: vitalhealthpsychiatry
articles.description:
Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) is often misunderstood by the general public, commonly reduced to stereotypes involving excessive hand washing or cleanliness. While these symptoms may be part of OCD, the reality of this complex mental health condition goes far beyond surface-level cleanliness. OCD is a serious and often debilitating disorder that affects millions worldwide, influencing thoughts, behaviors, and daily functioning in profound ways.
Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) is an anxiety disorder characterized by persistent, unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors or mental acts (compulsions) performed to reduce the distress caused by these thoughts. These obsessions and compulsions are intrusive, time-consuming, and interfere significantly with everyday life.
OC‚Ä¶
articles.title: More Than Cleanliness: The Truth About OCD

articles.author: Isadora Ribeiro
articles.description:
H√° cerca de 26 anos nasceu um protocolo de comunica√ß√£o de c√≥digo aberto, federado e com todos os princ√≠pios primordiais de liberdade e descentraliza√ß√£o que balizaram o in√≠cio da Internet.
N√£o... n√£o √© o SMTP - protocolo base da troca de e-mails (at√© porque esse √© mais anci√£o um pouco). Foi o XMPP (Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol), √† √©poca chamado tamb√©m de Jabber.
Diversas solu√ß√µes comerciais adotaram o XMPP para viabilizar seus produtos de mensagens instant√¢neas: Google Talk, WhatsApp e outros mensageiros nasceram sob as ra√≠zes do XMPP mas, ao longo do tempo, modificaram tanto o "idioma" (protocolo) que acabaram criando "dialetos" que somente usu√°rios da mesma plataforma conseguem se comunicar.
Imagine se o Gmail enviasse e-mail apenas pro Gmail. Se o Hotmail s√≥ enviasse e-mail‚Ä¶
articles.title: Recuperando a soberania e a privacidade da sua comunica√ß√£o pessoal e corporativa

articles.author: mahir dasare
articles.description:
This Helm chart deploys an Apache HTTP Server on a Kubernetes cluster.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helm/helm/main/scripts/get-helm-3
Package the chart:
helm package .
helm install apache ./apache --namespace apache-namespace --create-namespace
replicaCount: 2
image:
service:
resources:
Accessing the Deployment Check the status of your pods and services:
kubectl get pods -n apache-namespace

_kubectl port-forward svc/apache 8080:80 -n apache-namespace
Open your browser and visit:
http://localhost:8080
helm uninstall apache -n apache-namespace
**helm install apache ./apache \
Features
_helm version
Check Helm release status:
_helm status apache -n apache-namespace
Inspect pod logs:
kubectl logs  -n apache-namespace
articles.title: Apache Helm Chart

articles.author: mahir dasare
articles.description:
Steps to implement ingress:
2) Check minikube cluster status and nodes :
minikube status
3) Create one yaml file for apache deployment and service :
apiVersion: apps/v1
apiVersion: v1
4) Apply apache deployment :
kubectl apply -f apache-deployment.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
apiVersion: v1
kubectl apply -f nginx-deployment.yaml
minikube addons enable ingress
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
host: "tws.com"
http:
  paths:


path: /apache
pathType: Prefix
backend:
  service:
    name: apache-service
    port:
      number: 80
path: /nginx
pathType: Prefix
backend:
  service:
    name: nginx-service
    port:
      number: 80
9) Apply the Ingress resource :
kubectl apply -f ingress.yaml
echo "$(minikube ip) tws.com" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts
curl http://tws.com/apache to access the Apache service.
http://tws.com/apache
http://tws.com/nginx to access the NGINX service.
http://tws.com/nginx
OR
port forward to access the Apache service on browser.
kubectl port-forward svc/apache-service 8081:80 --address 0.0.0.0 &
port forward to access the NGINX service on browser.
kubectl port-forward svc/nginx-service 8082:80 --address 0.0.0.0 &
articles.title: Kubernetes Ingress Controller on Minikube Cluster

articles.author: Akshat Ramanathan
articles.description:
Content consumption is hard. With the amount of AI generated crap out there along with the dynamic and ever evolving landscape of the web; even when I try watching videos on youtube leisurely it becomes a binging session with hard disciplined study following each video. After about a year of such binge sessions and learning new technologies and stacks I realised my YouTube watch later and favourites playlists contents have become textbooks in themselves. 
So here I am, a fullstack web dev trying to annotate my thoughts as I go along surfing the web on my learning journey. From Java to PHP and from react to htmx I‚Äôll try to cover all kinds of content to learn and discover more and more about this strange world of web and leave no stone unturned. After 2 failed attempts at microblogging, this is gonna be a new take but with a twist. 
Concept - each post contains a video
I‚Äôm still working on the order of videos to cover. So stay tuned. The goal is to make 2 posts a week covering 2 elaborate videos. Feel free to follow me to get updates on upcoming posts and let‚Äôs begin the Dev Bytes!
articles.title: And so it begins

articles.author: Ayush Soni
articles.description:
‚úçÔ∏è If you're a students, builders, and blockchain beginners looking to understand Solana in plain English.
Solana is one of the fastest-growing blockchain platforms in the world ‚Äî and in this article, we‚Äôll break down what it is, why it‚Äôs different, and the core concepts that make it powerful. All explained in a clear, relatable, and builder-friendly way.
Solana is a high-performance blockchain designed for speed, scalability, and low transaction costs.
In simple terms, it‚Äôs like a super-fast, decentralized computer that anyone can use to build apps, launch tokens, create NFTs, or transfer money ‚Äî without needing a central authority or third-party service.
üß† Why it matters: Most blockchains are either powerful but slow, or fast but expensive. Solana is fast, affordable, and energy-efficie‚Ä¶
articles.title: üöÄ Getting Started with Solana: A Beginner-Friendly Guide

articles.author: Zyntraxis
articles.description:
Zyn is no different. It‚Äôs not just a build system ‚Äî it‚Äôs a source of unseen energy for your code, a silent catalyst empowering developers to create with flow and precision.
Maybe you‚Äôve heard of Zyn. Maybe you‚Äôve even used it. But what‚Äôs happening now is just the surface.
Like the tourmaline holding mysteries beneath its surface, Zyn holds potential that reveals itself only when you‚Äôre truly ready to tap into it.
The story is unfolding ‚Äî quietly, powerfully ‚Äî and it‚Äôs already rewriting the rules of how we build.
You‚Äôre part of this story.
Keep watching. The real power is yet to come.
articles.title: The Story of the Black Tourmaline and the Hidden Power Within Your Code ‚Äî Why Zyn Is Already Changing the Rules

articles.author: Tanmay Gupta
articles.description:
As you build more powerful Express apps, connecting to a database becomes essential. In this blog, we‚Äôll walk through how to:
Connect an Express app to MongoDB using Mongoose

Secure your credentials using .env

Prevent sensitive files from being tracked with .gitignore



Let‚Äôs get started.
In your project directory, install:
npm install mongoose dotenv

mongoose: ODM (Object Data Modeling) library for MongoDB
dotenv: Loads environment variables from .env files
.env File


In the root of your project, create a .env file:
touch .env

Add your MongoDB connection string:
MONGO_URI=mongodb+srv://<username>:<password>@cluster.mongodb.net/myDatabase
PORT=5000

Never share this file publicly.
.gitignore


To ensure .env and other sensitive files aren‚Äôt committed to Git, create a .gitignore file:‚Ä¶
articles.title: Connecting Express to MongoDB with Mongoose, .env, and .gitignore
